did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: David I. Wells papers, 1964-1980.
did.physdesc: Correspondence, subject files, legal briefs and papers, and other material.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, subject files, legal briefs and papers, and other material pertaining to Wells' career and interest in legislative representation and redistricting, including the Wells Vs. Rockefeller Supreme Court challenge, anti-gerrymandering legislation, presidential election system reform, and other legal cases concerning districting and reform.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Lecturer and writer on matters of apportionment.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, subject files, legal briefs and papers, and other material pertaining to Wells' career and interest in legislative representation and redistricting, including the Wells Vs. Rockefeller Supreme Court challenge, anti-gerrymandering legislation, presidential election system reform, and other legal cases concerning districting and reform.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: David I. Wells papers, #4917. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: State files contain various materials on redistricting in the state in general, as well as some correspondence and other material on D.W. involvements in the state. Note, for example, Colorado, where League of Women Voters successfully campaigned to get proposal drafted in part by D.W. onto the ballot through initiative process. Proposal passed (1974) and was incorporated into state constitution.
